title: 2008 Brazilian Grand Prix
summary: The 2008 Brazilian Grand Prix (formally the Formula 1 Grande Prêmio do Brasil 2008)[3] was a Formula One motor race held on 2 November 2008 at the Autódromo José Carlos Pace, Interlagos, in São Paulo, Brazil. It was the eighteenth and final race of the 2008 Formula One World Championship. Ferrari driver Felipe Massa won the 71-lap race from pole position; this was the last of Massa's 11 wins. Fernando Alonso finished second in a Renault, and Massa's teammate Kimi Räikkönen finished third.
